message:
If the class is properly written, there should be no problems creating multiple instances of it.

By "a simple lock around a regular collection", I mean you could just have a List<clientdata> protected by a lock. Concurrent collections are normally used if a lot of code is modifying the collection simultaneously (i.e., there is a lot of contention). But this is not usually the case for a list of client TCP/IP connections - it would only be modified if a client connects or disconnects.
